docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama '' We measure progress in the 23 million new jobs that were created when Bill Clinton was president when the average American family saw its income go up $7,500 instead of go down $2,000, like it has under George Bush.''
docs.abstract: Article evaluates claims made by Sens Barack Obama, Joseph R Biden Jr and Hillary Rodham Clinton at Democratic convention and Sen John McCain, Gov Sarah Palin and Rudolph W Giuliani at Republican convention; photos (M)
docs.snippet: Barack Obama     '' We measure progress in the 23 million new jobs that were created when Bill Clinton was president when the average American family saw its income go up $7,500 instead of go down $2,000, like it has under George Bush.''

byline.contributor: Patrick Healy reported from Minnesota, and Jeff Zeleny from Pennsylvania.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JEFF ZELENY

docs.lead_paragraph: Like Anne, a reader whose comment to a recent New Old Age blog post is excerpted below, my brother and I contributed in ways large and small to my mother's care at the end of her life, both before she ran out of her own money and went on Medicaid and after. We neither resented nor calculated what we spent during those years and, indeed, would have spent more but for worries about our own retirements and old age, a worry that Anne shares. Responding to a post about what Medicare and Medicaid pay for -- and what they don't -- and how adult children often make up the difference, Anne wrote:
docs.abstract: Out-of-pocket caregiving expenses cost on average $5,500 a year, and are probably higher.
docs.snippet: Out-of-pocket caregiving expenses cost on average $5,500 a year, and are probably higher.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new incarnation of “Beverly Hills 90210” debuted on Tuesday, and as with other popular teen dramas, the conceit isn’t fish out of water so much as fish moving into an even bigger swimming pool.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today we have a guest post from a personal finance blogger, Nina Smith, who recently visited Shifting Careers to tell readers why dipping into a 401 (k) is a bad idea.

headline.main: Are Personal Finances the Boss's Business?

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- Senator John McCain defended his choice of Gov. Sarah Palin as his running mate in an interview with ABC News, predicting that her speech tonight would win over skeptics and persuade Americans of her abilities.
docs.abstract: Senator John McCain predicts that Sarah Palin's speech will persuade skeptics.
docs.snippet: Senator John McCain predicts that Sarah Palin's speech will persuade skeptics.

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW PHILADELPHIA, Ohio - Senators Barack Obama and Joseph R. Biden Jr., in separate but coordinated appearances on Wednesday, criticized their Republican rivals for not focusing on the economy during the first night of speeches at their party's convention in Minnesota.
